VRPose.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The VRPose interface of the WebVR API represents the state of a VR sensor at a given timestamp (which includes orientation, position, velocity, and acceleration information).

blockquote.para: This interface was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: This interface is accessible through the and methods. is deprecated.

VRPoseOrientation.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The orientation read-only property of the interface returns the orientation of the sensor at the current timestamp, as a quaternion value.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: The value is a , made up of the following values:
The orientation yaw (rotation around the y axis) is relative to the initial yaw of the sensor when it was first read or the yaw of the sensor at the point that was last called.

VRPoseOrientation.value: A , or null if the VR sensor is not able to provide orientation data.

VRPoseAngularVelocity.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The angularVelocity read-only property of the interface returns an array representing the angular velocity vector of the at the current timestamp, in radians per second.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: In other words, the current velocity at which the sensor is rotating around the x, y, and z axes.

VRPoseAngularVelocity.value: A , or null if the VR sensor is not able to provide angular velocity information.

VRPoseLinearAcceleration.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The linearAcceleration read-only property of the interface returns an array representing the linear acceleration vector of the at the current timestamp, in meters per second per second.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: In other words, the current acceleration of the sensor, along the x, y, and z axes.

VRPoseLinearAcceleration.value: A , or null if the VR sensor is not able to provide linear acceleration data.

VRPoseAngularAcceleration.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The angularAcceleration read-only property of the interface returns an array representing the angular acceleration vector of the at the current timestamp, in meters per second per second.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: In other words, the current acceleration of the sensor's rotation around the x, y, and z axes.

VRPoseAngularAcceleration.value: A , or null if the VR sensor is not able to provide angular acceleration information.

VRPosePosition.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The position read-only property of the interface returns the position of the at the current timestamp as a 3D vector.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: The coordinate system is as follows:
Positions are measured in meters from an origin point — this point is either the position the sensor was first read at, or the position of the sensor at the point that was last called.

blockquote.para: By default, all positions are given as a sitting space position. Transforming this point with — when you are working with a room display for example — converts this to a standing space position.

VRPosePosition.value:
A , or null if the VR sensor is not able to provide position data.
NOTEUser agents may provide emulated position values through techniques such as neck modeling; when doing so they should still report as false.

VRPoseLinearVelocity.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The linearVelocity read-only property of the interface returns an array representing the linear velocity vector of the at the current timestamp, in meters per second.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: In other words, the current velocity at which the sensor is moving along the x, y, and z axes.

VRPoseLinearVelocity.value: A , or null if the VR sensor is not able to provide linear velocity data.
